description: Gets information about CloudHSM clusters. This is a paginated operation, which means that each response might contain only a subset of all the clusters. When the response contains only a subset of clusters, it includes a NextToken value. Use this value in a subsequent DescribeClusters request to get more clusters. When you receive a response with no NextToken (or an empty or null value), that means there are no more clusters to get. Cross-account use: No. You cannot perform this operation on CloudHSM clusters in a different Amazon Web Services account.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: One or more filters to limit the items returned in the response. Use the clusterIds filter to return only the specified clusters. Specify clusters by their cluster identifier (ID). Use the vpcIds filter to return only the clusters in the specified virtual private clouds (VPCs). Specify VPCs by their VPC identifier (ID). Use the states filter to return only clusters that match the specified state. (string) --- (list) --- (string) ---

nested_items.name: Clusters
nested_items.description: A list of clusters.

nested_items.name: BackupPolicy
nested_items.description: The cluster's backup policy.

nested_items.name: BackupRetentionPolicy
nested_items.description: A policy that defines how the service retains backups.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of backup retention policy. For the DAYS type, the value is the number of days to retain backups.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: Use a value between 7 - 379.

nested_items.name: ClusterId
nested_items.description: The cluster's identifier (ID).

nested_items.name: CreateTimestamp
nested_items.description: The date and time when the cluster was created.

nested_items.name: Hsms
nested_items.description: Contains information about the HSMs in the cluster.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone that contains the HSM.

nested_items.name: ClusterId
nested_items.description: The identifier (ID) of the cluster that contains the HSM.

nested_items.name: SubnetId
nested_items.description: The subnet that contains the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).

nested_items.name: EniId
nested_items.description: The identifier (ID) of the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).

nested_items.name: EniIp
nested_items.description: The IP address of the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).

nested_items.name: EniIpV6
nested_items.description: The IPv6 address (if any) of the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).

nested_items.name: HsmId
nested_items.description: The HSM's identifier (ID).

nested_items.name: HsmType
nested_items.description: The type of HSM.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The HSM's state.

nested_items.name: StateMessage
nested_items.description: A description of the HSM's state.

nested_items.name: HsmType
nested_items.description: The type of HSM that the cluster contains.

nested_items.name: HsmTypeRollbackExpiration
nested_items.description: The timestamp until when the cluster can be rolled back to its original HSM type.

nested_items.name: PreCoPassword
nested_items.description: The default password for the cluster's Pre-Crypto Officer (PRECO) user.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroup
nested_items.description: The identifier (ID) of the cluster's security group.

nested_items.name: SourceBackupId
nested_items.description: The identifier (ID) of the backup used to create the cluster. This value exists only when the cluster was created from a backup.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The cluster's state.

nested_items.name: StateMessage
nested_items.description: A description of the cluster's state.

nested_items.name: SubnetMapping
nested_items.description: A map from availability zone to the cluster's subnet in that availability zone.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The identifier (ID) of the virtual private cloud (VPC) that contains the cluster.

nested_items.name: NetworkType
nested_items.description: The cluster's NetworkType can be IPv4 (the default) or DUALSTACK. The IPv4 NetworkType restricts communication between your application and the hardware security modules (HSMs) to the IPv4 protocol only. The DUALSTACK NetworkType enables communication over both IPv4 and IPv6 protocols. To use DUALSTACK, configure your virtual private cloud (VPC) and subnets to support both IPv4 and IPv6. This configuration involves adding IPv6 Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) blocks to the existing IPv4 CIDR blocks in your subnets. The NetworkType you choose affects the network addressing options for your cluster. DUALSTACK provides more flexibility by supporting both IPv4 and IPv6 communication.

nested_items.name: Certificates
nested_items.description: Contains one or more certificates or a certificate signing request (CSR).

nested_items.name: ClusterCsr
nested_items.description: The cluster's certificate signing request (CSR). The CSR exists only when the cluster's state is UNINITIALIZED.

nested_items.name: HsmCertificate
nested_items.description: The HSM certificate issued (signed) by the HSM hardware.

nested_items.name: AwsHardwareCertificate
nested_items.description: The HSM hardware certificate issued (signed) by CloudHSM.

nested_items.name: ManufacturerHardwareCertificate
nested_items.description: The HSM hardware certificate issued (signed) by the hardware manufacturer.

nested_items.name: ClusterCertificate
nested_items.description: The cluster certificate issued (signed) by the issuing certificate authority (CA) of the cluster's owner.

nested_items.name: TagList
nested_items.description: The list of tags for the cluster.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: Mode
nested_items.description: The mode of the cluster.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: An opaque string that indicates that the response contains only a subset of clusters. Use this value in a subsequent DescribeClusters request to get more clusters.
